 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 2.4 - NAVIGABLE
BYPASS BLOCKS(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

A mechanism is available to bypass blocks of content that are repeated on
multiple Web pages. 

These websites...

Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
An e-commerce website includes a long list of filters prior to the search
results listing. A link above the list enables users to skip the filters and get
to the product results quickly. I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/bypass-blocks.html#examples] Web
Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)  * Subscribe
   [https://dwcag.org/subscribe]
